programme.title: Golf: PGA Championship
programme.desc: Action from day three of the Rolex Series DP World Tour event at Wentworth Club in Surrey. Tyrrell Hatton was the last British player to win this event when he claimed the title in 2020, adding his name to a list of homegrown champions that includes Danny Willett, Rory McIlroy, Luke Donald, and Colin Montgomerie

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the mystery drama. The sleuthing senior citizen is urged by an old friend to visit her sister as she is convinced something is wrong. Miss Marple heads for the country to investigate and it is not long before a heated argument in a locked room ends with a gunshot that leaves a man dead. Feature-length episode of the mystery drama, starring Joan Hickson, with Jean Simmons and Joss Ackland. First broadcast in 1991

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: The television presenter sits down for a conversation with his special guest, the great American musician, composer and bandleader Duke Ellington. First broadcast 24 February 1973

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo and Jerry sow the seeds of an idea which prompts Tom and Barbara to consider a holiday. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Jim is saddled with the impossible job of developing his governments integrated national transport policy. Anthony Jay and Jonathan Lynns comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Miss Marple

Feature-length episode of the mystery drama, starring Joan Hickson, with Jean Simmons and Joss Ackland. First broadcast in 1991

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.sub-title: The Mary Rose: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: Historian Dan Snow explores the discovery, excavation and raising of the ship, finding out what the latest research has revealed about the vessel and her crew. The presenter also investigates how the project helped create modern underwater archaeology, and examines the techniques, challenges and successes of the divers and archaeologists involved

programme.title: Golf: PGA Championship
programme.desc: Action from day four of the Rolex Series event in the DP World Tour, held at Wentworth Club in Surrey. American Billy Horschel triumphed at this event for the second time in his career last year, having previously lifted the trophy in 2021. The event was decided in a three-way play-off, with Horschel edging out Northern Irelands Rory McIlroy and Thriston Lawrence of South Africa

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: Highlights from the worlds biggest classical music festival, featuring performances by Anoushka Shankar, Pacho Flores, Liya Petrova, Nicholas McCarthy, Klaus Makela, Dalia Stasevska and Le Consort Ensemble and pieces by Vivaldi, Mendelssohn, Mahler, Vaughan Williams and Shostakovich

programme.title: Jessye Norman at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by American opera singer Jessye Norman, tracing her journey from spirituals and traditional folk songs to her landmark debut at the London Proms. Featuring interviews with the star across the decades

programme.title: Jessye Norman and the Spiritual
programme.desc: Soprano Jessye Norman presents a concert in speech and song in which she performs a selection of spiritual songs and explains their background and historical significance. Accompanied by pianist Philip Moll and the Ambrosian Singers, conducted by Willis Patterson. First broadcast in 1981

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Orchestral concert film, taking a journey along rivers around the world accompanied by music composed by Richard Tognetti and William Barton. Footage from different landscapes reveal how rivers have shaped the world, creating caverns, valleys and fertile plains, and revealing how they have shaped the history of human civilisation, and been affected by it in turn. Narrated by Willem Dafoe

programme.title: Genius of the Ancient World
programme.desc: Historian Bettany Hughes investigates the ideas of ancient philosophers, starting with the Indian nobleman Siddhartha Gautama, more popularly known as Buddha. Thought to have been lived and tought between the sixth and fourth centuries BC, the sage and holy man inspired a diverse belief system that influences the lives of millions of people to this day. She travels to India, where the Buddha experienced the challenging ideas and extreme methods of wandering truth seekers, after he had abandoned his family and homeland in the Himalayas to embark on his philosophical quest to find a solution to human suffering

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens explores Wales cultural history, beginning on Anglesey where he steps inside a prehistoric burial chamber to witness Welsh art in its earliest form. He also views an exquisite example of Bronze Age artistry in the shape of a gold cape, found by chance in a field in north Wales and now one of the prize exhibits in the British Museum

programme.title: Jessye Norman at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by American opera singer Jessye Norman, tracing her journey from spirituals and traditional folk songs to her landmark debut at the London Proms. Featuring interviews with the star across the decades

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents further coverage of the second session on day one of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. The first medals to be awarded on the track in this session come in the womens 10,000m at 1.30, which saw a clean sweep for Ethiopia two years ago in Budapest, with Gudaf Tsegay, Letesenbet Gidey and Ejgayehu Taye first, second and third respectively. Finals also take place in the mens shot put from 1.10 and mixed 4x400m relay at 2.20, as well as heats in the mens 100m from 10.55. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Jenny Meadows, and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a couple looking for a new home in Cornwall, and gets a crash course at a sailing school which supports people of all abilities

programme.title: Early Man
programme.desc: Young Dugs sheltered life with his Stone Age tribe is shattered by bronze-mining invaders led by greedy Lord Nooth. To win his home back, desperate Dug gambles on challenging these more sophisticated folk in a contest they love, but he only knows from rock paintings - football. Director Nick Parks animated adventure, with the voices of Eddie Redmayne, Timothy Spall, Rob Brydon, Miriam Margolyes and Johnny Vegas

programme.title: Michael McIntyres Big Show

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The ED staff must remain professional as they treat a divisive patient. Iain is unable to face Faith and runs away from his problems. Dylan worries when Flynn is late to work again and has clearly not been home for a few days, and Ngozi prepares to say goodbye, while Nicole grapples with her emotions in the build-up to the leaving party

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.sub-title: Last Night of the Proms: The Finale
programme.desc: Further live coverage from the Royal Albert Hall of the climax of the classical music festival, including a brand-new, specially commissioned orchestral version of Bohemian Rhapsody, to mark the 50th anniversary of the Queen classic. Louise Alder sings a My Fair Lady medley, and trumpeter Alison Balsom performs Bernstein. And of course, all the traditional favourites return to close the season. Presented by Katie Derham, with special guests including Ted Lasso star Nick Mohammed

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker visit the Worcestershire village that provided the inspiration for The Archers, and continues to inspire storylines on the radio soap to this day. Plus, Datshiane Navanayagam delves into one of the countrysides most divisive issues - the tensions over second homes

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Shuttleworth House in Bedfordshire, where she delves into the history of the houses traction engine collection and gets to see one in action. She also finds out about 19th-century engineering industrialist Joseph Shuttleworth, who made his fortune from agricultural machinery. Items valued include diamond earrings, a lunar souvenir and an umbrella stand in the shape of a bear

programme.title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams
programme.sub-title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams: Ultimate Test
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff heads to Manchester and discovers one of the most dilapidated clubs he has ever seen, with a clubhouse that is almost derelict and not enough players for even one team. He sets himself a deadline to get it back up and running by the end of the summer. In Blackpool, the girls team suffers a crisis of confidence when Freddie introduces the hard ball to training, then to make matters worse, theres a divide in the team

programme.title: King and Conqueror
programme.desc: Harold and Edith risk their lives to bargain with William but get a guarded reception. Harolds siblings face hardships trying to secure their familys future

programme.desc: Kelly Cates presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, featuring Manchester City v Manchester United at Etihad Stadium and Burnley v Liverpool at Turf Moor. The Citizens were looking to avenge a 2-1 defeat at the hands of their local rivals in last seasons corresponding fixture, while champions Liverpool were looking to maintain their 100 per cent record so far this term against the newly promoted Clarets. Plus, a round-up of yesterdays goals

Also taking place is qualifying for the mens hammer and womens pole vault from 1.00 and 1.05 respectively, and the heats of the womens 3,000m steeplechase from 1.15 and 400m hurdles from 3.20. With commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

Meanwhile, Gavin and Stacey make an announcement that does not exactly fill their friends and relatives with joy, and Bryn has a heart-to-heart with Jason. programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: The girls go shopping for Janets wedding dress, little suspecting what an epic adventure they are embarking on. Jonny and Gaz decide to set out on a search of their own, and are thrilled to discover an unattended barrel of beer. Comedy, starring Ralf Little and Will Mellor

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents coverage from day two of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. The mens and womens 100m finals took centre-stage, as the fastest athletes in the world were crowned, and medals were also decided in the womens marathon, discus and long jump, and the mens 10,000m

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Delving into the not-so-easy lives of children throughout history, from the strict parenting of ancient civilisations, to the terrible fights the young King Louis XIV had with his little brother - even weeing on each others beds. And find out just why Henry VIII was so keen for his son Edward VI to stay inside

programme.title: Early Man
programme.desc: Young Dugs sheltered life with his Stone Age tribe is shattered by bronze-mining invaders led by greedy Lord Nooth. To win his home back, desperate Dug gambles on challenging these more sophisticated folk in a contest they love, but he only knows from rock paintings - football. Director Nick Parks animated adventure, with the voices of Eddie Redmayne, Timothy Spall, Rob Brydon, Miriam Margolyes and Johnny Vegas

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The time comes for one couple to flare out of Honeymoon Island, signalling the end of their relationship. On the other beaches, the couples swap partners for the day to gain some valuable insights into their marriages, resulting in some fiery exchanges on their return. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: An intimacy crate washes up to help the honeymooners get personal, and when the couples spend the day apart at beach picnics, some are left reeling from shocking revelations - before a new couple jump into stranded life together. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: A crate containing the couples mobile phones washes ashore, revealing more than anyone bargained for. David drops a bombshell to Ini, causing shockwaves at the Couples Cove. And when night falls, a movie serves up some even bigger surprises for the honeymooners. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott discovers the dark side of Thailands backpacker culture. In the first episode, she lands in trouble with the Thai police when she starts to uncover the scale of Thailands illegal sex industry. A visit to the Bangkok Immigration Detention Centre exposes how easy it is to get caught on the wrong side of the law

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets men chasing cheap thrills in Asias sex capital, Pattaya, and also talks to a local sex worker, who reveals the harsh reality of working in the illegal sex industry. She then heads to Ko Phangan, an exotic island famed for its spirituality and beauty. For Zara, this is paradise - but Lucio, a Brit who built a burgeoning cannabis business here while the drug was decriminalised, reveals that navigating the local law isnt always easy

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott experiences Ko Phangans famous Full Moon Party, but beneath the cheap cocktails, music and fire shows, theres danger lurking as the medical team treat a possible drink-spiking victim. She then travels to Phuket and experiences a taste of Thailands luxury lifestyle. But she also learns how dream holidays can quickly go wrong, hearing the case of a British holiday-maker who died on the island - and whose family is still searching for answers

programme.desc: Zara McDermott explores the islands economy, with access to luxury clubs, yachts and villas, as well as the local police, undercover detectives and emergency medics. programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: Where Have All the Floorboards Gone?
programme.desc: Its Norms birthday, so as a surprise, Sam arranges for Boston Celtics basketball player Kevin McHale to drop in and present him with a team jacket. However, when the star gets dragged into a pointless discussion, it obsesses him for weeks to come - and completely destroys his ability on the court. Bar-room comedy, starring Ted Danson and George Wendt

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam asks Carla to help him exact revenge on John Allen Hill, the irritating owner of the seafood restaurant above Cheers, but she ends up falling for him instead. Meanwhile, Cliff faces a new challenge at work _ riding a horse. Comedy, guest starring Keene Curtis, with Ted Danson and Rhea Perlman

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Woody has trouble proposing to Kelly, especially as Henri has already tricked her into saying she will marry him, claiming he is about to be deported. American bar-room comedy, starring Woody Harrelson and Jackie Swanson

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: When Rebecca gets the all-clear from the doctor she realises its Sam who needs to take a fertility test, while Frasier finds it difficult to make a will. Ted Danson stars, alongside Kirstie Alley

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert begins taking Debra out swing dancing, but Ray feels they are becoming too close and schemes to break up their partnership. Comedy, starring Ray Romano

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert and Amy move into Rays basement in a bid to get some privacy, but they fail to account for Marie - who spoils their plans. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Brad Garrett, Doris Roberts and Monica Horan

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The radio stations new manager disagrees with everything Frasier says - and when the shrink objects to her ideas, he finds his show rescheduled at two oclock in the morning. Comedy, guest starring Mercedes Ruehl, with Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles suggests he and Frasier set up practice together - but after a series of disasters, they end up in need of therapy themselves. Comedy, guest starring Milo OShea, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer recalls his musical heyday as a member of the Be Sharps barbershop quartet, when he performed for President Reagan along with Principal Skinner, Barney and Apu. Featuring the voices of David Crosby and George Harrison

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family heads to New York after Bart hears his ex-girlfriend Mary Spuckler (Zooey Deschanel) is living there. But once he arrives, the spiky-haired youngster revisits a few more of his old flames - voiced by Anne Hathaway, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Natalie Portman and Sarah Silverman - while Lisa and Marge take in the local culture

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first hosts in the North East, brothers Zak and Shuhel, are confident that their modern twist on traditional Indian cooking will impress their fellow professionals, at Babuls in Darlington. Their plant-based dessert is a game-changer for two vegan rivals, but their starter leaves their other guests - fellow Indian restaurateurs - feeling cold. Next up, will Alice and Alexs pizza fingers and meat-free burgers impress their rivals picky palettes, at their vegan restaurant, V-Edge, in Middlesbrough? The night ends on a high as the rival restaurateurs reveal their previous professions and share unusual impressions alongside the dessert. Finally, Shay and Syed host at their traditional family-run Indian restaurant, Sheesh Mahal, in Hartlepool. After two strong nights, will their lamb alternative wow their vegan guests?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Caroline and Gary from Wiltshire fulfil their long-held dream of owning a house in Spain for regular getaways to the countryside and villages of Valencia province. She shows the pair five options for their budget of £150,000 - but will they love any of them enough to put in an offer?

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George has the idea of turning a rusty scissor lift into a cabin in the sky and starts his Denmark trip with a visit to a modern take on the old Viking longhouse. After a bus from a previous series burned in a fire, its owner replaces it with an ambitious new build made of four shipping containers. Plus, a beautician and her daughter create a four-wheeled beauty parlour

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer scour the Sussex coast for two sets of house-hunters at opposite ends of their property journey. Kirsties with retired painters and decorators Amanda and Annette, who want a spacious bungalow in a serene setting to suit their futureproofing needs. Eighteen months ago, Amanda was diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis, making both of them realise that they wanted to seize life and move to their dream forever home. Kirstie shows them different options but by the end theres a clear winner. But can Kirstie secure it for them when its offers over their maximum budget... Meanwhile, Phil helps first-time buyers Danit and Rafi, who are after a one-bed flat close to the buzz of Brighton and Hove. Although they both agree that being close to the areas vibrant queer and Jewish communities is a top priority, Rafi wants Brighton and Danit prefers Hove. All the flats Phil offers up are in contention and it soon becomes clear that their biggest challenge is agreeing on their preferred property

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp catches up with Kathleen and Tom to see how far they have come with the renovations to their four-bedroom Newcastle home. The couple first appeared on the show back in 2016 when their three-bedroom Victorian terrace in Gosforth, had become a four-year Love It or List It battleground. In 2019, Phil Spencer returned and learnt that the couple had made the leap to the spacious home they now reside in

programme.title: Worst House on the Street
programme.desc: Best friends Brad and Billy have bought their first home together to get on the property ladder, but all they could afford is a very dated and run-down house in Coventry. Scarlette and Stuart Douglas help them to make the most of their new home

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Trainee crew members of the starship Enterprise embark on their maiden flight, which pits them against a Romulan commander from the future who is planning a horrific revenge on those he blames for a tragedy in his own time. Sci-fi adventure based on the original TV series, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Eric Bana, Zoe Saldana and Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Britains Railway Empire in Colour
programme.desc: To mark the 200th anniversary of the birth of rail, this series reveals the story of how Britain gave railways to the world - from the first tentative experiments with steam power, through the domestic boom years, to the exporting of this transformative new technology to all corners of the globe. Experts and enthusiasts and extensive newly colourised archive explore the truly revolutionary nature - both good and bad - of the locomotive. The first episode tracks how the railways grew from coal trucks in the north-east of England to transforming the lives of the Victorians. Trainspotter Francis Bourgeois tells the story of his 19th-century equivalent, schoolboy George Tod, who took stunning black and white photographs of his favourite engines. These and other photographs have been colourised, bringing the old railways back to life. There are also stories from the Empire as well as narratives from closer to home, including the magnificent Forth Bridge

programme.title: The Popes Exorcist
programme.desc: Father Gabriele Amorth, chief exorcist of the Vatican, investigates a rundown abbey in San Sebastian. The owner, Julia, claims her 12-year-old son Henry has been possessed by a demon. Local priest Father Esquibel is unprepared to tackle the profanity-spewing malevolence, so Amorth lends his years of experience to the case. Horror, starring Russell Crowe and Daniel Zovatto

programme.title: The Last Stand
programme.desc: Disgraced narcotics cop Ray Owens retires into a quiet life as sheriff of a small town on the Mexican border. He gets the chance to prove his worth as a law enforcer when a drug lord escapes from prison and tries to flee the US - with his escape route taking him through Rays jurisdiction. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Johnny Knoxville and Forest Whitaker

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay steps in to assess a troubled Brooklyn restaurant thats sinking into debt. As an additional problem, its co-owners are constantly clashing. Can the acerbic chef help sort out the finances and operations before it folds?

programme.title: Huge Homes with Hugh Dennis
programme.desc: The actor visits a labyrinthine home in Berkshire, which exists in the realms of fantasy - boasting a moat, a throne room and the mock ruins of a faux medieval Abbey. In Essex, he views a striking modern mansion with groundbreaking eco credentials sitting proudly on the edge of Epping Forest. Hugh gets up close and personal with its green innovations, including a climb up to its living roof. Finally in Staffordshire, Hugh calls in to a Jacobean stately pile which boasts gorgeous period charm along with all the pioneering gadgets a modern home could ever want, including a helicopter, private train and a hidden home cinema

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by comedian and author Rosie Jones for a journey round the Midlands exploring the best staycation retreats they have to offer. The pair begin in Rutland where they stay at the Rocket Lodge, an eco-build made of upcycled grain silos that boasts a wood-fired hot-tub, a circular kitchen and a disco bathroom. In the sand dunes on a strip of the Lincolnshire coastline, the duo stay in a rebooted 70s beach house called Sandy Feet where Sandi learns that Netflix and chill doesnt mean what she thinks it does. They end their trip close to the Welsh border on the Walcot Estate in a 200-year-old hideaway known as the Wheelwrights shop that once lived 20 miles away but was dismantled and transported piece by piece before being rebuilt to look exactly the same

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.sub-title: Double Decker Retreat and Boat Hotel
programme.desc: The architect meets a carpenter who wants to turn a 30-year-old double-decker bus into a luxury holiday retreat, and a couple using their life savings to design a boat hotel. He also visits a house in Oxford made from mud and straw, and builds a camping deck out of a motorway drainage pipe for his own tree-house project

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer recalls his musical heyday as a member of the Be Sharps barbershop quartet, when he performed for President Reagan along with Principal Skinner, Barney and Apu. Featuring the voices of David Crosby and George Harrison

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family heads to New York after Bart hears his ex-girlfriend Mary Spuckler (Zooey Deschanel) is living there. But once he arrives, the spiky-haired youngster revisits a few more of his old flames - voiced by Anne Hathaway, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Natalie Portman and Sarah Silverman - while Lisa and Marge take in the local culture

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon OBrien restores an old bluegrass banjo with the help of professional luthier Gary

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam and Rebecca go on a baby-making weekend break but begin to have doubts about the whole thing when they realise they are not in love. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: Dont Shoot, Im Only the Psychiatrist
programme.desc: Sam foolishly allows Woody to cut his hair, and Frasier brings the members of his therapy group for those with low self-esteem to the bar, in the hope they can meet normal people. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Woody has to take a second job as a gravedigger to pay for Kellys engagement ring and soon finds himself hallucinating due to lack of sleep. Starring Ted Danson and Woody Harrelson

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Carla opposes her sons decision to become a priest, Sam finds a way to get even with John Hill, and Cliff begins a new life as a stand-up comedian. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Rhea Perlman

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Ray reminisce about how they met, recalling incidents such as Maries first encounter with her future daughter-in-law. Comedy, starring Ray Romano

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra is upset at Rays reaction to a friends breast enlargement, and decides to play a trick on him to see if he really is happy with her body the way it is. Comedy, starring Ray Romano

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The family prepares to mourn a relatives death, and while Frasier and Niles organise the funeral in their usual hopeless style, Martin tries to finish a song he began writing for Frank Sinatra. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Kate encourages Bulldog to continue his audience-grabbing practical jokes against Frasier, who decides to exact a suitable revenge - blissfully unaware that such pranks have a nasty habit of backfiring. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Dan Butler

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by Hamza Yassin, Craig David, Conor Benn, Gbemisola Ikumelo, Oti Mabuse and Lara Lewington. With music by Calum Scott

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is surprised to learn that his accountant neighbour Dan works for Fat Tony - and has been asked to take the Mob bosss place while he serves time on a jury. Meanwhile, Lisa decides to add insects to her diet, but is plagued by a series of nightmares. With the voice of Steve Carell

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns sets out to be reunited with his beloved teddy bear, which he lost as a child. Unfortunately, it is now owned by Maggie, presenting Homer with an unenviable dilemma. Featuring the voices of the Ramones

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge and rebellious new friend Ruth set off for a girls night out - but end up being pursued at high speed through the streets of Springfield by Chief Wiggum and a distraught Homer

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Art Bank in Dalbeattie, Dumfries and Galloway, where Mandy and Suzanne hope artistic flair will win them the week - but a shared bathroom is an instant black mark

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to the Tithe Barn Hotel in Cockermouth, Cumbria where hosts Amy and Anna hope their host-less hosting wont put off their guests but the self-check-in causes problems for one duo. Mandy and Suzanne dig up some issues from their own feedback during a visit to a mining museum, before the journey to the off-site breakfast the next morning proves hard to swallow for some BandBers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On day three, married couple Dave and Meru hope their guests will love their traditional seaside guest house, The Sanderling in Morecambe. A walk along the Morecambe coast surprises some of the BandBers, and a well-received bargain breakfast gives the hosts reason to be cheerful, but will some less-than-spotless cleanliness scores in the feedback tarnish their chances?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The weeks final visit is to the Curious Fox in Skipton, North Yorkshire, where hosts Lee and Janette think their combination of rooms and fine dining will wow their fellow competitors. However, an unwelcome discovery in one room could scupper them

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Toilet troubles, bathroom bothers and some very picky comments are all on the agenda before the payments are disclosed and it is revealed who has won

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its crunch time for the bakers as biscuit week arrives, seeing them take on a slice and bake signature, produce a classic chocolate Hobnob in the technical and make their favourite mementos out of biscuit in the showstopper. Alison Hammond and Noel Fielding find out who will be top cookie and who will crumble under the pressure, while Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith judge their efforts

programme.title: Inside McVities
programme.desc: Observational documentary going behind the scenes of one of Britains best-known brands, McVities, as they gear up for their busiest time of year. McVities have been baking the nations biscuits and cakes since 1839, and this programme offers unprecedented insight into the brand and the staff behind the scenes as they look to innovate classic recipes and make a small mountain of biscuits in time for Christmas

programme.title: Educating Yorkshire
programme.desc: A year 10 student who plays for a youth rugby team harbours dreams of international professional stardom, but his ambitions are in jeopardy when Mr Burton threatens to call the head coach if his attitude doesnt improve. One of his classmates struggles with anxiety, especially when she falls out with a friend and faces being dropped down a set after a low score in a science test

programme.title: The Inheritance
programme.desc: Two players are cut from the will, and the Deceased sets a request that pushes the remaining players further than ever as they fulfil the final orders of her wellness brand. From collecting honey at height to coming face-to-face with snakes, the players must decide how far theyll go to be the best. The Division Ceremony delivers its own chaos as secrets spill out and whispers turn into rifts

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Inheritance, You Bet! on Tour, KPopped, Emmerdale, The Guest and 90 Day Fiance UK. They also review a This Morning feature on roast dinners and ITV News coverage of the resignation of Angela Rayner as deputy prime minister

programme.title: My Massive C**k
programme.desc: Men with exceptionally large penises reveal how this has affected their lives, from the embarrassment of people staring and difficulties with clothing, to uncomfortable sex and even causing injuries to their partners. While some have learned to live with the implications of their unusual bodies, others are considering surgical solutions to reduce the size

programme.title: Isolated
programme.desc: Finnish thriller about an island that is mysteriously cut off from the outside world, leaving the inhabitants confronted with their darkest fears. Rocky relationships are undermined further by stress while uninvited guests fuel paranoia. Some of the islanders have fantastical ideas about what is behind this uncanny limbo they have been cast into, and supplies are soon running out. Starring Elena Reeve. In Finnish

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to New Jersey to transform Maxs Bar and Grill. Even though its been serving up famous hotdogs for almost 100 years, its on the verge of crumbling, with over $1million of debt. The situation isnt helped by a power struggle between the divorced owners, who still work together

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A compilation of memorable stories filmed at Kings College Hospital in south London. Five-year-old Isa is rushed to AandE after being hit by a car and trapped underneath it, and doctors suspect the impact may have caused serious internal damage, as well as significant head injuries. Drama student Florian, 21, has tripped and hurt his foot rushing to class, and 83-year-old widower Harry has collapsed while out shopping

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: When a car collides with two children walking home from school, two ambulances, a doctor and a critical care paramedic are sent to the scene. Paramedics also treat a man whos having back-to-back epileptic seizures, and a four-month-old baby with a barking cough is finding it increasingly difficult to breathe

programme.title: The Donald Trump Show
programme.desc: A novel take on the US presidents second term in office, recutting archive news clips as drama to retell Trumps story. The first episode focuses on the tumultuous, unlikely and once-close relationship between Donald Trump and Elon Musk - from hitching their wagons together on the campaign trail to an explosive public falling-out over the release of Donalds policies and the Jeffrey Epstein files

programme.desc: Ben journeys into the heart of Zambia to live with a British family who have built a safari lodge on the edge of a national park. Ben uncovers what prompted this intrepid couple to start a new business and a family in the unforgiving bush, and learns how they have had to overcome fire and flooding to keep their African dream alive

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: The presenter travels to the Azores islands, a remote archipelago in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean, to meet Magnus, Lucy and one-year-old Frey. The family live in an off-grid cottage on a steep sloped mountain which Magnuss nomadic father bought in the 1980s, and they have spent the past 15 years taking on the gargantuan task of restoring the property and land

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben spends a week in Dorset with former paratrooper Chris who, despite losing nearly everything, has spent the last five years walking the UKs coastline. Ben joins Chris and his faithful dog companion, Jet, 27,000 miles into their walk, and also meets Chris partner and fellow hiker, Kate. Whilst in their company, Ben learns how to desalinate sea water, forage the nature around him and how to charm local fisherman for food

programme.title: Susan Calmans Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Susan steers her campervan around some of the beauty spots of Devon and the south coast of England, and gets the chance to dig into the footsteps of renowned fossil hunter Mary Anning, as well as fulfilling the dream of driving a vintage tram. She then discovers why South Devon is a top spot for growing chilli in the UK and handles the worlds hottest - very carefully - as she helps to plant the latest crop

programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: Dalby and Cropton forests are in the midst of a heatwave and for some creatures the heat could be deadly, with bumblebees forced to stay in their nests so they do not overheat. Ecologist Cath is on a mission to discover just how many new members of the resident beaver family there are, while dedicated volunteers monitor appearances of the turtle dove, which is on the brink of extinction

programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: The warm summer days continue in Dalby and Cropton Forests, and cameras capture the forests youngsters as they investigate their new surroundings, from fawns nervously exploring, to badger cubs appearing out of their setts for the first time and learning how to play-fight with their siblings. Meanwhile at the beaver pond, cameras follow herons as they lurk by the water and stalk their prey

programme.title: Portillos Andalucia
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the region of Andalucia in southern Spain, visiting six of his favourite locations in the area, beginning with Granada. Staying in the grounds of the Alhambra, he meets food writer Fiona Dunlop to learn about Granadas traditional cuisine, and tries his hand at the potters wheel in a 500-year-old family business

programme.title: Portillos Andalucia
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Malaga in time for Augusts feria, one the biggest street parties in Spain, meeting a street band most of whose members are called Portillo. He then travels 40 miles inland to the hilltop town of Ronda, stopping off at a vineyard along the way, ending his journey at a convent dating back to the 16th century, where he meets the mother superior and discovers they hold one of the Catholic churchs most important relics in the form of the hand of St Teresa

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: National and international news

programme.title: Great Gardens of Europe
programme.desc: A look at Trsteno Arboretum in southern Croatia, which is perched on a limestone cliff and boasts a rich history that spans more than 500 years. The programme uncovers its opulent Renaissance origins, featuring ancient stone columns, sprawling ornamental trees, sun-drenched citrus groves and intricately designed maze-like shrubs

programme.title: Glamis Castle: A Royal Retreat
programme.desc: A look at the castle in Angus, which was the childhood home of Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, and playground for her daughter Elizabeth, the future queen. One of the oldest royal residences in Britain, this pink-painted fairy-tale fortress has been the family home to the Lyons, one of Britains oldest aristocratic families. Experts including Paul Burrell and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen reveal the secrets of a house that helped shape the world views and personal convictions of Elizabeth II and her mother

programme.title: The Royal Rich List 2025: Whos Worth the Most?
programme.desc: Top finance and royal experts lift the velvet curtain on the fortunes of one of the richest families in the world, with assets, including Buckingham Palace and the Crown Jewels, estimated to come to a total worth of over £21billion. But who is the richest of them all?

programme.title: Zara and Mike: the Royal and the Rugby Player
programme.desc: Charting the story of Zara, Queen Elizabeth IIs eldest granddaughter, and rugby hero Mike Tindall, and how they cemented their places in the hearts of the British public. And asking if in this new, slimmed down royal family, should they have a frontline role?

programme.title: When TV Goes Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Fern Britton narrates a selection of TVs most memorable guests, whether theyre suffering a slip of the tongue, a technical meltdown or having a bust-up. Featuring less-than-perfect appearances by Piers Morgan, Jonathan Ross, Stormzy, Shirley Bassey, Bez, Lembit Opik and Kathy Burke. Contributors include presenters Richard Arnold, Lucrezia Millarini, James Whale and Stephen Bailey.

programme.title: Rescue 999: Seconds to Save a Life

programme.desc: The singer ends her road trip through the state in Miami, going on a walking tour of the city that takes in the Clevelander Hotel and Gianni Versaces old house. Jane also goes for a speedboat ride around the Venetian Islands, before heading Little Havana to experience Miamis Cuban heritage

programme.title: Holidaying with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: Using the famous Caesars Palace as her base, Jane shows there is more to Las Vegas than the casinos. With new friends joining her for the adventures, she flies high above the famous Strip on a zip wire, tests her stamina at one of the citys all you can eat buffets, plunges off the side of an 800ft building and hits the high notes when she sings on stage with her teen idol, Donny Osmond

programme.title: Holidaying with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The singer visits Puerto Vallarta on Mexicos Pacific west coast, famed for its golden beaches, dramatic jungles and vibrant culture. She explores the rain forest on a quad bike, rides the waves in a surfers paradise, and takes to horseback for a polo lesson from a world champion

programme.title: My Cornwall with Fern Britton
programme.desc: Part one of two. The presenter embarks on a personal quest to understand what makes the county she loves so uniquely captivating. Fern Brittons love affair with Cornwall began with sand between the toes adventures on childhood holidays in Looe, and its there she starts her journey

programme.title: Cumbria: The Lakes and the Coast
programme.desc: In Brampton, Michelin starred chef Hrishikesh Desai reinvents his menu and cooks up a masterpiece with ingredients from his garden. A community in Haweswater comes together to reintroduce endangered water voles into the Cumbrian landscape for the first time in decades. Plus, off the coast of Walney Island, locals Amy and Jack set sail for lobster

programme.title: Live Cricket
programme.desc: England v South Africa. Coverage of the third and final T20 of the series from Trent Bridge, Nottingham. The teams have not met here in this format since 2009, when South Africa claimed a seven-wicket victory during the ICC World Twenty20. In more recent times, England have won just one of their last three T20s here, winning against India either side of defeats at the hands of Pakistan and New Zealand

programme.title: Live: NFL Big Game Night
programme.desc: Miami Dolphins v New England Patriots. Coverage of the week two match between the AFC East teams, held at Hard Rock Stadium, joining in progress 30 minutes after kick-off. Both teams missed out on the play-offs last season, with the Dolphins finishing second in the division, but some distance behind Buffalo Bills, with an 8-9 record, and the Patriots ending the campaign with just four wins all season. Both meetings between the teams in the previous campaign saw Miami prevail, winning 15-10 at Gillette Stadium and 34-15 here. Tonights coverage will also feature the game within a game quiz element, whenever the NFL game stops in the US

programme.title: Rich Holiday, Poor Holiday
programme.desc: Return of the documentary in which people from different sides of the wealth divide trade vacations. In the opening edition, support worker Cheryl and her factory employee son Harvey trade holidays with entrepreneur friends Marco and Paul, with Cheryl and Harvey jetting off to the super-rich playground of Dubai, while Marco and Paul go motorhoming in Surrey and Southend-on-Sea.

programme.title: Inside the Four Seasons: Park Lane
programme.desc: A look at how the Four Seasons does love, with head of guest experience Andrea saving an anniversary with some emergency heart-shaped balloons and florist Ros taking a last-minute order for 500 mixed roses for a very particular guest. A couple whose son was born at the hotel return, chef Benjamin celebrates the 150th visit of superfan diner Mary and an important pooch gets a VIP welcome

programme.title: Hotel Benidorm: Fun-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Documentary following life in the Spanish resort, this time at the Hotel Benidorm Plaza as Easter sees the start of the new holiday season. Checking in this week is a female rugby team from Manchester looking to let off some steam, a couple returning to relive their honeymoon, and friends hoping for solace in the sun

programme.title: Murdered at First Sight
programme.desc: A look at the murder of 11-year-old Carlie Brucia, who was kidnapped in 2004 when walking home in Sarasota, Florida. Security footage later revealed that she was abducted in broad daylight by Joseph Smith, a man recently released from prison. Carlies body was found near a church and Smith, who had a violent criminal past, was identified and arrested

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willys Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals why male seahorses give birth, and looks at how hyena packs are dominated by the female members

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores natures evolutionary anomalies and examines creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines animals that are able to expand their bodies, including anacondas and camels

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals the unusual ways in which flamingos and blue whales eat, examining the ways feeding patterns have influenced both species behaviour in similar ways

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The surprising preventive and curative medicine developed by certain species, including the hippopotamus, which secretes a red slime to act as a highly efficient sun screen

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Two families with remarkable powers of regenerating unusually large body parts easily - salamanders, which do so when a large chunk, such as the tail or a limb, has been bitten off by a predator, and male moose, which grow and shed antlers every year

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist continues to explore the secrets behind evolution, this time focusing on the animal kingdoms bizarre hybrids, including the pizzly bear, a cross between a polar bear and a grizzly, which is thought to have come into being as a result of global warming. He also covers the killer bee brought into existence due to the transfer of African bees to South America

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Footage of animals that have unusual means of finding their way around. Dung beetles are able to navigate by the sky, using the position of the sun, moon and stars to determine which is the right direction to go in, while pigeons display remarkable powers of memory, able to recall complex travel routes and follow manmade roads and hedgerows

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist explores the extremes of birth in the animal kingdom, explaining why the giant panda gives birth to the smallest babies of any existing mammal. He also looks at the kiwi, asking why the bird produces a single egg that is a quarter of its body mass - one of the largest in the world - and almost too big to lay

programme.title: Africa from Above
programme.desc: A fresh perspective, taking viewers on an aerial adventure. From dramatic coasts that teem with wildlife to bustling cities, explore the people, places and wildlife of South Africa

programme.title: Africa from Above
programme.desc: An in-depth look the Kenyan Highlands, the countrys vast savannahs, and the turquoise waters of the Indian Ocean

programme.title: Africa from Above
programme.desc: Follow the Volta River from the Sahel savannahs of the North, through fertile cocoa-laden hills at the heart of the nation, and across the biggest man-made lake in Africa

programme.title: Africa from Above
programme.desc: Head to the most populous landlocked country on Earth to view Lake Tana, Ethiopias largest lake, and the Great Green Wall, to see communities fighting desertification

programme.title: Africa from Above
programme.desc: Discover the rich biodiversity of the Pearl of Africa, where spectacular landscapes include the glacier-tipped Rwenzori mountains, ancient rainforests and crater lakes

programme.desc: Morocco is the gateway to Africa, and this epic adventure explores the Mediterranean coastline, the mighty Atlas mountains and the seemingly endless Sahara

programme.title: Hue and Cry
programme.desc: A schoolboy in post-war London stumbles on a criminal conspiracy whose members use his favourite comic strip to secretly send information to each other about their illegal activities. The police do not take him seriously, so he enlists his friends to help stop the crooks. Ealing comedy, starring Alastair Sim, Harry Fowler, Jack Warner and Valerie White

programme.title: The Personal History of David Copperfield Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Armando Iannucci and actor Dev Patel, who stars in the title role, talk about bringing Charles Dickens beloved novel to the screen

programme.title: Ferdinand
programme.desc: After a bull with a big heart is mistaken for a dangerous beast, he is captured and torn from his home. Determined to return to his family, he rallies a misfit team on the ultimate adventure. Animated comedy, with the voices of John Cena, Kate McKinnon and Bobby Cannavale

programme.title: Babe
programme.desc: A kindly farmer wins a cute piglet, which some greedy humans and jealous animals hope will end up as the Christmas roast. Undaunted, the young pig proves himself useful on the farm and enlists the aid of the resident dog in learning how to herd sheep. Family comedy, starring James Cromwell and Magda Szubanski, with Christine Cavanaugh, Miriam Margolyes and Hugo Weaving among those providing the voices of the animal characters

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: The pig and his farmyard pals take a trip to the big city, where their curiosity and love of adventure lands them in trouble, leaving the courageous Babe to find a way to save his chums from danger. Family comedy sequel, starring Magda Szubanski, Mickey Rooney and James Cromwell, and featuring the voice of Elizabeth Daily as Babe

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis Wain: Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpes eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain

programme.title: Charlies Angels
programme.desc: Whistleblower Elena Houghlin has evidence that the Calisto energy conservation project can be hacked for nefarious means. Former MI6 agent Jane Kano and heiress jailbird Sabina Wilson intervene to save Elena from an assassin and attempt to steal the remaining Calisto devices before they can be weaponised. Comedy thriller inspired by the TV series, starring Kristen Stewart, Ella Balinska, Naomi Scott and Elizabeth Banks, who also wrote and directed

programme.title: The Lost City
programme.desc: Reclusive author Loretta Sage writes about exotic places in her popular adventure novels that feature a handsome cover model named Alan. While on tour promoting her new book with Alan, Loretta gets kidnapped by an eccentric billionaire who hopes she can lead him to an ancient citys lost treasure from her latest story. Determined to prove he can be a hero in real life and not just on the pages of her books, Alan sets off to rescue her. Adventure comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Channing Tatum and Daniel Radcliffe

programme.title: The Shape of Water
programme.desc: Elisa Esposito is a mute singleton who lives above a cinema. Although friends with Giles, a neighbouring artist, she lives a lonely existence. While he has designs on the cafe worker nearby, Elisa cleans up at top-secret government lab, a bus ride away in Baltimore, Maryland. One day in 1962, she makes a life-changing discovery when Elisa finds an amphibious humanoid creature who is being held captive, and they embark on an extraordinary relationship. Guillermo del Toros Oscar and Bafta-winning fantasy, starring Sally Hawkins, Michael Shannon, Octavia Spencer and Doug Jones

programme.title: Werewolves Within
programme.desc: A proposed gas pipeline divides the small town of Beaverfield. The day its residents meet at the local inn, a severe snowstorm batters the area, trapping everyone inside the establishment. As tensions between the opposing sides heighten, it is up to forest ranger Finn and postal worker Cecily to keep the peace and find out the person responsible for the appearance of a mysterious creature that is terrorising the community. Horror comedy, starring Sam Richardson and Milana Vayntrub

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: June, a science-loving little girl, and her mother spend hours playing with stuffed animals and other toys, fashioning a world of imagination connected to a fabulous theme park. When Junes mom is diagnosed with a life-threatening illness and has to go away for treatment, June finds a real version of her theme park. Animated family adventure, with the voices of Mila Kunis, Jennifer Garner and Kenan Thompson

programme.title: The Personal History of David Copperfield Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Armando Iannucci and actor Dev Patel, who stars in the title role, talk about bringing Charles Dickens beloved novel to the screen

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: The war between the shape-shifting robots erupts once again, as the first of the evil Decepticons leads an attack on Earth to locate an ancient planet-destroying machine. Hapless teenager Sam Witwicky is caught in the middle of the ensuing conflict as he holds the key to discovering the location of the device. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder, and determined to save others suffering his same fate, biochemist Dr Michael Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. However, what at first appears to be a radical success soon reveals itself to be a remedy potentially worse than the disease, when he develops a form of vampirism. Comic-book adventure, starring Jared Leto, Matt Smith, Adria Arjona and Jared Harris

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: A cops career is seemingly over when he accidentally shoots a hostage while thwarting a bank robbery. He is given the chance to redeem himself by joining an elite unit headed by a veteran sergeant. Their mission is to escort an international crime lord in custody as he is taken to prison. However, they hit a snag when their prisoner offers a multimillion-dollar reward to anyone who breaks him out of jail, placing them under attack from every criminal in the city. Action thriller, starring Samuel L Jackson and Colin Farrell

programme.title: Capernaum
programme.desc: In Beirut, Zain is a young boy of uncertain age who is in prison for stabbing someone. He is also suing his parents for neglect. Writer/director Nadine Labakis Cannes Jury prize-winning, Oscar-nominated drama, starring Zain Al Rafeea. In Arabic and Amharic, with English subtitles

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: A gunslinger rides into a backwoods town intent on finding his dead wifes former lover and exacting revenge for her death. The man he blames now has total control of the town and has the sheriff at his beck and call. Undeterred, the drifter offers his enemy an ultimatum - he has until sundown to leave the town or face retribution for his crimes. Western, with Randolph Scott, John Carroll and Andrew Duggan

programme.title: The Gunfighter
programme.desc: Gunslinger Jimmy Ringo looks forward to a life of domestic peace after being given a chance to settle down with his once estranged wife and their child. However, a young upstart with dreams of slaying a legend challenges Ringo to a gunfight but dies, setting his three vengeful brothers on the older mans trail. Western, starring Gregory Peck, Millard Mitchell, Karl Malden and Helen Westcott

programme.title: Yellow Sky

Western, starring Gregory Peck, Anne Baxter and Richard Widmark

programme.title: Hell Is for Heroes
programme.desc: A rebellious soldier defies orders to lead two men on a secret attack on a German pillbox, but his mission fails and the other two soldiers are killed. Second World War adventure, with Steve McQueen, James Coburn and Bobby Darin

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Gruff detective Jack Frosts plans for a quiet weekend are disrupted by the gruesome discovery of an unidentified body floating in the river. However, soon after he has begun the investigation, he is forced to apply his deductive skills to a separate case involving an act of violence during a football match which left a player in a coma. Crime drama, starring David Jason, Larry Lamb, Bruce Alexander, Lindy Whiteford and Berwick Kaler

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: After having his career scrutinised by the General Medical Council because of his blood phobia, Martin makes efforts to overcome his fear and begins to question whether he made the right decision about resigning. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The surgery is chaotic, with both Martin and Louisa now practising from it. Berts new business venture with Al doesnt get off to a good start, and Penhale suspects noise complaints are due to paranormal activity. Drama, starring Martin Clunes as a surgeon who is forced to retrain as a GP and takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village, where he soon finds himself at odds with the locals

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Happiest Days of Your Life - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Primrose falls for a roofing contractor, while the twins prove too much of a handful for their school, prompting a trip to view the facilities on offer at Brockhurst College. Nostalgic comedy drama, starring David Jason and Pam Ferris

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Happiest Days of Your Life - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The twins abscond from Brockhurst College, but Pop manages to bring them back safe and sound - then lends his services to ensure the boarding school does not have to close. Meanwhile, Primrose makes an unusual request concerning affairs of the heart and Charley launches a bid to buy a local brewery. David Jason stars

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crackd from Side to Side
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours, including the halls previous owner Dolly Bantry. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the stars unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Following the suicide of Jeanie Long, the woman convicted of the murder of teenager Abigail Mantel 11 years earlier, new evidence comes to light exonerating her. DCI Vera Stanhope reinvestigates the case, but to find out who really killed Abigail, the detective must uncover the secrets of a close-knit community that is still coming to terms with the incident. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves novel Telling Tales, guest starring Hugo Speer alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Wunmi Mosaku and Paul Ritter

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A land dispute escalates during a cowboy fair run by the Wild West Society in the village of Ford Florey. Farmers Jack Fincher and Silas Burbage both claim to own a patch of wasteland known as the Swamp, but Dan Malko wants to buy it and create a travellers site. Barnaby and Jones are called in when the feud leads to murder during the Wild West-style shoot-outs at the annual event. Guest starring Kenneth Cranham, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Downton Abbey: A New Era
programme.desc: The Crawley family goes on a journey to the South of France to uncover the mystery of the dowager countesss newly inherited villa and back home in the UK, a film production company wants to use Downton to shoot a silent film. Robert questions his true parentage when the Marquis de Montmiral implies they could be half-brothers. Drama, starring Hugh Bonneville, Jim Carter and Michelle Dockery

programme.title: Downton Abbey Celebrates the Grand Finale
programme.desc: Join the cast of Downton Abbey in a toast to the global phenomenons final chapter.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Calum is rushed to hospital after attempting suicide. He dies shortly afterwards, and to Jimmy dismay, Sandy admits to giving Calum the pen he used to kill himself. Convinced that Aaron McGuire is the key to unlocking the murder cases and finding Zezi, Perez heads to Glasgow, where he joins forces with DI Sam Boyd from the trafficking unit. Together they talk to Claire McGuire, Aarons ex wife who runs an employment agency in the city centre. Could Glasgow businessman Gilbert Benson be the man behind one of Jimmys toughest assignments? Drama, starring Douglas Henshall, Steven Robertson and Kate Dickie

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Having heard of the traumatic events in Glasgow, an angry Duncan confronts Jimmy over his fears for Cassies safety. Although shaken, Cassie seems pleased that Perez has trusted her with the truth. Now sure that Zezi is still being held on the island, the detective and Sandy pay Morag Dunwoody a visit in an attempt to extract further information. Before long, matters take a more dramatic turn. Drama, starring Douglas Henshall and Mark Bonnar

programme.desc: Morse suspects a connection between a womans disappearance and her past employer, but another missing persons case demands his attention in the form of a notable artist, whose work adorns the covers of a series of paperback mysteries. Meanwhile, reports flood in of stolen cars and wanton criminal damage, as a debauched group of university undergraduates wreak havoc, while the murder of a uniformed officer sees Bright order all hands on deck at Castle Gate. Much to Morse and Thursdays chagrin, the cast of TV detective show Jolly for Short is in town filming the final series

programme.sub-title: Cast Not Your Pearls Before Swine - Part Two

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth helps an old friend find refuge at country house Greenshaws Folly, but a sinister shadow falls over the strange buildings various inhabitants and a murderer strikes. Julia McKenzie heads an all-star cast that includes Jim Moir (better known as Vic Reeves), Kimberley Nixon, Fiona Shaw, Robert Glenister, Julia Sawalha, Judy Parfitt and Matt Willis (formerly of pop group Busted)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A murder at a remote cottage in Northumberland takes DCI Vera Stanhope back to a place full of childhood memories and reminds her of an unsolved case from earlier in her career. Delving into the local politics surrounding a controversial proposal to dig a quarry, she and her team find motives in the unlikeliest of places - until they realise that the truth could be hidden within the land itself. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves novel The Crow Trap, guest starring Daniela Nardini (This Life) alongside Brenda Blethyn

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. Gathering at Hulton Manor, a sprawling edifice on its own island, a storm rages outside adding to the immersive experience of the fictional murder playing out in front of them, until one of them tumbles down the stairs, and is impaled by a life-size Egyptian figure - killing him for real

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A fishermans body is found tangled up in a North Sea trawlers net. Vera and her team investigate with the help of the local harbourmaster, and find the dead mans sons pointing the finger at the owner of a fish market, with whom they have a long-running feud. Retracing the dead mans steps, Vera discovers when he drowned and tracks down a waitress who may have been one of the last people to see him alive. However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead mans sister-in-law goes up in flames

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: In 1989, Ann Ming is distraught when her 22-year-old daughter Julie Hogg goes missing, but the police shrug off her concerns, suggesting that she must have fled to London to reunite with her estranged husband. Knowing in her heart that Julie would never leave her brother Kevin behind, Ann uncovers a mothers worst nightmare. Fact-based drama, starring Sheridan Smith

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: Haunted by nightmares of her daughters body, Ann channels her grief into putting pressure on the police for answers, while also battling to save her marriage from crumbling under the strain. Anns hopes of getting justice are boosted when a local man is arrested, but the accused seems to be scrutinised less than Julie when it comes to the trial and the bungled investigation leads to an unthinkably awful outcome

programme.title: Live World Series of Darts
programme.desc: Jacqui Oatley presents coverage of day two of the World Series of Darts Finals, held at AFAS Arena in Amsterdam, featuring eight more first-round matches, played over the best of 11 legs. Stephen Bunting has been in good form this year, but he suffered a shock defeat at the hands of Boris Krcmar at the end of this stage in 2024. Luke Littler also didnt have things all his own way in round one 12 months ago, but eventually prevailed 6-5 against Ross Smith before going on to win the title. Luke Humphries had a more comfortable path to the second round, beating Haupai Puha 6-3. With analysis from Chris Mason, Alan Warriner-Little and Mark Webster, and commentary by Stuart Pyke, John Rawling, and Ned Boulting

programme.title: Live World Series of Darts

Eventual champion Luke Littler was also given a tough match before prevailing 6-4 against veteran Raymond van Barneveld, and the man he beat in the final, Michael Smith, was taken to a deciding leg by Wessel Nijman. programme.desc: YouTube star Joe Sugg uncovers some incredible stories in his family tree, with a little help along the way from big sister and fellow social media influencer Zoe. Very aptly, Joe discovers a great-great-great grandfather who was involved in the earliest days of communication technology - in electrical telegraphs. Pushing further back, he finds seven-times-great grandparents who fled religious persecution in France and a goldsmith who survived the Great Fire of London

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Star of stage and screen Judi Dench sets out to research her ancestry, beginning with her father Reginald Dench. He never spoke of his experiences during the First World War, so she tries to find out how he won his gallantry medals. Judis investigations then take a truly epic turn, leading her to 16th-century Denmark and nobility. The actress also discovers, to her delight, some remarkable Shakespearean links

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follow the story of reunited siblings Geoffrey Tonks and Barbara Jacobs as they investigate a family mystery and try to trace a missing sister on Geoffreys fathers side. They also catch up with Robert Lindsay, who explores the difficulties of building a father/son relationship so late in life, and brother and sister Nicholas Rhoades and Cayley Cox talk about how they have already experienced an enormous amount together in the year that has passed since they met for the first time

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Couples are taken to see three or four properties for sale in a foreign country that they want to move to or frequently holiday in

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help Joselyn Taylor, who has been searching for her elder brother James to find out why she was put in a childrens home at two weeks old. James in turn has also been searching for the father he never knew and had only been able to dream about

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of three men brought up in the care system who are trying to reconnect with the families that were taken from them. Murray Phillips was adopted from a childrens home as a young boy with his older brother Ricky, who was sent back to the childrens home when he was 12, leaving nine-year-old Murray completely devastated and confused. Eighty-seven-year-old Mark Chesterfield spent a large part of his childhood at a foundling hospital and has been trying to reclaim his identity ever since he found out at the age of 74 that he wasnt an orphan, as hed always believed, but had a mother whod wanted to be part of his life. Having traced her side of the family, he came to Long Lost Family to find out about his fathers side

programme.title: Nationwide
programme.desc: The story of Dillon Quirke, a talented young hurler who died of Sudden Adult Death Syndrome and whose memory, spurred on the Tipperary senior hurling team to victory in the All-Ireland final against Cork in July 2025. This time, their fate is in the hands of 2020 champion Thomas Frake, 2010 winner Dhruv Baker and 2017 victor Saliha Mahmood Ahmed.
