programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: The box is locked and the key is missing, but Mike and Frank take a chance hoping to find some hidden treasure

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: One mans junk is Mike and Franks treasure as they scour junkyards in search of rusty gold

programme.title: Guy Martin: Last Flight of the Vulcan Bomber
programme.desc: The mechanic joins a select crew of engineers working to prepare the last Vulcan bomber that is capable of flight for a farewell tour of the UK. The programme features contributions from former crew members, who recall its service in conflicts from the 1950s to the Falklands, as well as serving as Britains nuclear deterrent

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around £2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britains finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britains motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D, Nat, John, Linda and the rest of the bidders are in Northampton trying to outbid each other. Ione goes head to head with Sam - and who will be left as a bridesmaid when a wedding carriage comes up for grabs? Sean Kelly hosts

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D, Nat, John, Linda and the rest of the bidders are in Southampton trying to outbid each other. Sean Kelly hosts

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees bidders in Lewes battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate some of their favourite indulgent dishes for entertaining guests, receiving money-saving tips from Michelin-starred chef Tom Kitchin and delving into British culinary history for gourmet inspiration. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they help a lifeboat helmsman say a surprise thank you to his crew

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to create a gourmet party on a tight budget, preparing cut-price canapes, cakes and tasty treats, with Michelin-starred chef Nigel Haworth giving advice on vegetarian food. Finally, they put everything they have learned to the test when they arrange a surprise celebration for 35 farm volunteers

programme.title: The Americas with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon travels the length of California. He climbs to the top of one of the worlds tallest trees, and meets the fire crews tasked with tackling the ever-present danger of wildfires, a growing threat given the states changing climate and chronic shortage of water. He also meets street doctors providing much-needed medical support to people living in extreme poverty and visits a city on the desert for Americans who have dropped out of the rat race entirely

programme.title: The Americas with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The explorer travels from Texas to southern Mexico, meeting a woman who risks her life to take supplies to migrants stranded on the Mexican side of the border in Reynosa, one of the countrys most violent cities, which is dominated by a powerful criminal organisation. He also ventures into the rainforest to explore the Maya city of Yaxchilan, and meets the modern-day descendants of this civilisation, who are increasingly marginalised and treated as second-class citizens

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch a Criminal
programme.desc: An RSPCA Special Ops team investigate an international criminal puppy farming operation, and Lancashire officers prosecute an owner for animal cruelty

programme.title: Alison and Larry: Billericay to Barry
programme.desc: Alison Steadman and Larry Lamb go on the final leg of their road trip, joining a male Welsh choir in Newport and trying their hand at gin-making before heading to Barry Island

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz, with comedian Jamie MacDonald and ITVs Deputy Political Editor Anushka Asthana joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel game, with Maisie Adam, Susan Calman and Josh Widdicombe joining regular Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of testing

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, John Robins and Holly Walsh join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the weeks events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First shown in July 2016

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Loyiso Gola, Milton Jones, Miles Jupp, Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the weeks events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Stephen Bailey introduces comedians Lara Ricote and Glenn Moore to the Hammersmith Apollo stage where they perform their stand-up acts in front of a live audience

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: David agrees to sub in for the annual baseball game, and Moira runs a rehearsal that pushes Stevie over the edge

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Johnny and Moira accidentally run over a cat, while David has a run-in with an old colleague who has a business very similar to Rose Apothecary

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Patricks parents are in town for his surprise party, but end up getting a surprise of their own. Alexis drags Moira to a soap opera convention. Sitcom, starring Noah Reid

programme.title: Schitts Creek
programme.desc: Johnny fills in for Moira at the annual Mayors Roast. David distracts Moira from finding out that Stevie and Patrick are taking private dancing lessons. Sitcom, starring Eugene Levy

programme.title: Gassed Up
programme.desc: Rapper Mist takes on entrepreneur Spencer Matthews in a high altitude, high stakes, precision driving challenge, in one of Britains most accessible motorsports and one of the events most dangerous courses

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Chris inherits a Greek cafe, which Sharon runs on his behalf - with Tracey as her skivvy and Dorien making the sandwiches. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon makes a go of it at the cafe, but Tracey finds it hard to feel pleased for her. Meanwhile, Dorien becomes preoccupied with more romantic pursuits. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: When faced with a hefty dentist bill, Lovejoy agrees to settle it by investigating the alleged death by drowning of Terence Sullivan, a fellow antiques dealer. It doesnt take long to determine that Sullivan is still alive, having taken up residence with an attractive stewardess. When Charlotte sees Lovejoys caring side towards the widow, she feels she may have misjudged his character and finally gives in to his seductive charm. Pete Postlethwaite guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A friend who runs a fairground asks Lovejoy to sell silver candlesticks on his behalf, but the police arrive and reveal they are stolen property. Jimmy Jewel and Phil Daniels guest star, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Never Judge a Book by Its Cover
programme.desc: While searching a Cambridge antiques fair for religious books with Charlotte and Charlie Gimbert, Lovejoy discovers a rare Bible that seems to offer a solution to all his problems. Meanwhile, Tinker has a hard time persuading Beths father that she should carry on working for such a rogue. Drama, guest starring Richard Briers and James Ellis, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The visit of Princess Margaret to Kembleford is jeopardised when a school caretaker is found murdered. It falls to Father Brown to resolve matters and save the royal occasion from being cancelled. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Father Brown discovers theres more drama offstage than on in the latest production by the Kembleford Players. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthias district nursing rounds find her tending a diabetic man who turns out to be a terrible bully to his wife, while Jenny looks after a black mother-to-be being subjected to racial prejudice from her neighbours. Nonnatus House prepares for the return of Chummy from Sierra Leone - but she has her own surprise. Miranda Hart, Jessica Raine and Bryony Hannah star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra Pullman and the team re-open the 17-year-old case of a murdered policewoman when it is revealed that a gun discovered in a diving operation was used to kill her. The team suspects a stalker, seen in the area at the time, is responsible for the killing, but when DNA evidence reveals that the same gun was also used in an armed robbery six months previously, a web of lies involving a faked robbery and a gang of money-laundering thieves is exposed. Amanda Redman stars

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team members have to draw on their powers of detection and discretion when a painting in the Queens private collection is found to be a fake - and all the clues lead to an art forger and political activist who seemingly committed suicide after a fire destroyed his studio. Meanwhile, prospective grandfather Standing has to sell his beloved Triumph Stag to buy his pregnant daughter a pushchair. Anthony Head guest stars alongside Dennis Waterman and Amanda Redman

programme.title: Signora Volpe
programme.desc: When the son of an old friend is arrested for murder, Sylvia interrupts her hunt for a stolen truffle pig in order to investigate

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Philip Henderson is found dead in his field following an altercation the previous day with his neighbour Doug Randall about his failed crop. Suspicion falls on the neighbour and his new wife, who was known to have had ongoing problems with Philip over his unpaid bar tab at her pub. However, as Mike and the team dig further into the mystery more suspects come into play. Neill Rea stars

programme.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
programme.desc: Edmond locates Gaston, Villeforts illegitimate child, who has grown up to be a thief. Danglars discovers Fernands treacherous deeds in Algeria and reveals all to the press

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A black man is murdered in a jail cell by a confirmed racist - a crime the prison service blames on overcrowding. However, the judges probing reveals the institution wasnt operating at full capacity. A drink-driving appeal puts the bench at loggerheads, and Jo distances herself from her former lover. With Donald Sinden and Jenny Seagrove

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthias district nursing rounds find her tending a diabetic man who turns out to be a terrible bully to his wife, while Jenny looks after a black mother-to-be being subjected to racial prejudice from her neighbours. Nonnatus House prepares for the return of Chummy from Sierra Leone - but she has her own surprise. Miranda Hart, Jessica Raine and Bryony Hannah star

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Chris inherits a Greek cafe, which Sharon runs on his behalf - with Tracey as her skivvy and Dorien making the sandwiches. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Strange occurrences are unfolding in Brokenwood, but most perplexing is the mysterious death of a man crushed by a chandelier

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: On her first shift as a sergeant, Jo is called to the scene of an aggravated robbery in which the homeowner died in a particularly violent and bloody way. When it emerges the victim was an abusive drunk and had been involved with another woman, Grace warms to the mans Asian-born widow and clashes with Max over his apparent racial prejudice. Gabrielle Glaister guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A letter bomb addressed to the manager of a successful company proves to be harmless but, after talking to the witnesses, Grace has a hunch that worse is to follow. The intended victim turns out to be cheating on his pregnant wife with his secretary, and a courier bears a grudge after being thrown out of the office, but the main suspect is the managers own brother, who had recently been sacked

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A desperate woman barricades herself with her younger son into her estranged husbands house and alerts the police to the fact her children are being neglected and abused by their father. Jo establishes a computer link with her and builds up a measure of trust, but is concerned for the welfare of the boy when a shot is fired inside the house

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Callum is off duty when he intervenes in an argument and is badly beaten by a man. The assailant is released due to lack of evidence and Callum takes matters into his own hands

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Callum, Jo and Mel sort out a fight outside a club, in which a woman is seriously injured. An inquiry is launched when it is revealed the club has been robbed and a witness to the scuffle accuses Callum of assault after being pushed over and suffering an epileptic fit. Julie Graham (Survivors) joins the cast as Commander Lisa Kennedy

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Philandering lawyer Judge Harding (guest star Jack Dee) is convinced he is being blackmailed by a mystery woman out to destroy his reputation and turns to Kingdom for help. But as Peter gets to know Harding, he faces the repercussions of the mans past relationship with Beatrice. Meanwhile, Lyle tries to mediate in a land dispute between golfers and druids. Stephen Fry, Hermione Norris and Karl Davies star

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Lyle travels home to Stockport to help save his mothers allotment, Scott is suspended from school after being caught misbehaving on CCTV, while Peter helps a family avoid accusations of paedophilia over the issue of recording a school concert. Elsewhere, Mr Snell surprises everyone by getting married. With Stephen Fry, Karl Davies and Tony Slattery

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Peter helps an aristocrat whose brother has started selling off titles, and receives shocking news. Meanwhile, Lyle aids a small-holder taking on a pharmaceutical giant, and Beatrice learns to fish. Drama, starring Stephen Fry, Karl Davies and Hermione Norris

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons The Glass Virgin
programme.desc: Feature-length drama from the pen of the popular storyteller. A woman runs away from her wealthy family after she discovers a shocking secret about her past. Nigel Havers, Emily Mortimer and Brendan Coyle star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Veronica spearheads a new council initiative to monitor the health of working children in the borough and despite a successful clinic, she is shocked by the childrens wellbeing. Trixie is thrown into a challenging case involving an underage mother, who - after a fallout with her parents, is at risk of losing her newborn baby. Monica Joan welcomes an unusual guest into Nonnatus House and Fred worries about the pressure one of his paperboys is under to support his father and younger siblings

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: The Met contact DI Gillespie when there are rumours of sightings of Baron Battenberg, a man who has been missing for more than five years. With the press and police in a frenzy, Sam and Ruth go undercover at a retreat run by the absent mans wife and brother to investigate. When an equally curious journalist is murdered, Sister Boniface is brought in to help with the inquiry. Lorna Watson stars

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team attends a triple murder at a farmhouse, where the investigating detective, Supt Tom Byrne, wastes no time making his presence felt. The pathologists soon make a breakthrough when DNA found at the scene matches that of a mysterious female serial killer - although Nikki has cause to question the direction they are heading in. The case is proving difficult for Leo, however, whose mind is in turmoil following the suicide of an old friend. Guest starring Vincent Regan and Shelley Conn

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ted leads an investigation into the apparent suicide of a City trader who was embroiled in the cut-throat world of Londons financial district in the 1980s. As the team delve deeper into the macho fraternity of The Wolfpack, they find a darker side to the debauchery, secret hand signals and all-nighters that bonded the traders together - including a strict hierarchy that might be worth killing for. Meanwhile, Steve tries to learn some tricks of the trade, amid his own financial crisis. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries

With the press and police in a frenzy, Sam and Ruth go undercover at a retreat run by the absent mans wife and brother to investigate. When an equally curious journalist is murdered, Sister Boniface is brought in to help with the inquiry. Lorna Watson stars

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: The normally laid-back country copper gets hot under the collar when an arsonist burns down the local school - but thats nothing compared to the anger Esme feels on discovering Rory and the council are linked to the crime. Robert Carlyle, Brian Pettifer and Anne Lacey star

programme.desc: The run-down state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Dels latest foolproof scheme to make a million involves a spot of salmon-poaching, but the wheeler-dealer finds the bracing country air is not all its cracked up to be. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a Queen Anne original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Dels. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Del-Boy embarks on a new romance with Raquel, an actress he meets through a computer dating agency, while Rodney takes Nervous Nerys out for a burn in the three-wheeler - but as ever with the Peckham twosome, nothing goes quite according to plan. Christmas special from 1988, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters go on a lads day out to Margate with their mates, but things do not go as expected when their bus blows up, leaving them stranded overnight in the seaside town. Finding a room in the hotel from hell, the brothers are only too happy to go out and sample the local nightlife - and thats when Del-Boy gets a blast from the past. Feature-length Christmas special from 1989, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Blackadder: The Lost Pilot
programme.desc: Tony Robinson introduces the previously unseen pilot episode of the popular comedy

programme.title: Knowing Me, Knowing You - With Alan Partridge

programme.title: Knowing Me, Knowing You - With Alan Partridge

programme.desc: Gasforths finest are called in to police a group of rowdy environmentalists protesting against a proposed bypass - one of whom just happens to be Inspector Fowlers girlfriend Patricia. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson and Serena Evans

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part One: The American Dream
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Trotters get a chance to escape Peckham for a holiday in the Florida sun - but it means Del leaving his newborn son behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Buster Merryfield, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong, Denis Lill and Roger Lloyd Pack

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part Two: Oh to Be in England
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Trotters arrive in Florida, and walk straight into disaster after their camper van is burgled and local Mafiosi take a shine to Del-Boy, who bears more than a passing resemblance to their boss. What Del does not know is that they are planning to have him killed as a way of faking the godfathers death to help him escape being sent to prison. Feature-length episode of the comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a cameo appearance by Bee Gee Barry Gibb

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Always one to jump on the latest passing bandwagon, Del-Boy goes eco-friendly and decides to create a better world for baby Damien and his generation - by starting his own bottled water business. Starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Buster Merryfield and Tessa Peake-Jones. Christmas special from 1992

Starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Buster Merryfield and Tessa Peake-Jones. Christmas special from 1992

programme.title: Dads Army

Jimmy Perry and David Crofts classic wartime comedy, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier and Clive Dunn. First broadcast in 1969

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses

programme.title: The Bill

Meanwhile, Emma finally discovers the extent of her husbands psychological bullying when Will puts her in touch with Matts ex Nina Lloyd

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Will is horrified to learn Matt is pressing for a charge of attempted murder against Emma and sets out to expose the control freaks vicious bullying tendencies with help from former victim Nina Lloyd. Dan takes pity on a drug addict who takes him hostage during a raid on a crack house and offers to help her by securing a place on a rehabilitation programme

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sam, Diane and Nikki see a young woman fall from a walkway on the Cole Lane estate and learn that the womans alcoholic husband holds himself responsible for her injuries. Meanwhile, Mickey sets up an underground operation to investigate the activities of a pub card-sharp. Pooja Shah guest stars

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. programme.desc: The Queensland Ambulance Service are on hand to help a young girl who calls after her grandfather falls. The ambulance is delayed after witnessing a car crash en route

programme.title: Ambulance Australia

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Paramedics Mat and Patia race to help a woman who has given birth in a car. Trainee Millie shows incredible composure to get through an intense emergency call

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: A Queensland ambulance crew respond to a life-threatening motorbike crash. Paramedics Ashley and Armahn treat a woman who has overdosed on drugs

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing and TOWIE star Pete Wicks immerses himself in the heart-warming and emotional world of dog care at Basildons Dogs Trust rehoming centre. Its Petes first day at Dogs Trust, and he meets a pug facing a worrying surgery and pregnant dog who was seized at the border

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets a litter of puppies known as the Potato Pups, who were found abandoned in a crisp box, and helps the staff fight to keep them alive

programme.title: Multiple Birth Wards
programme.desc: The first of two documentaries following the highs and lows of life for couples during multiple pregnancies. Filmed over eight months, the programme meets two sets of parents-to-be in London - Paul and Tracy, who conceived naturally, and Chris and Steph, who succeeded through IVF treatment after seven years of trying. Meanwhile, in Liverpool, Miraz and Selma celebrate when their triplets are delivered, and Selmas mother flies over from Turkey to help take care of the newborns

programme.title: Multiple Birth Wards
programme.desc: The number of multiple births has almost doubled in the past 30 years - a rise attributed, in part, to changing lifestyles and the increased use of assisted reproduction techniques such as IVF. The concluding part of the documentary follows Melanie and Martin from Devon, who are expecting triplets, and young Birmingham doctors Matt and Caroline, who are waiting anxiously for the moment they can go home with their premature twins. And in Liverpool, Sean and Kerrie look forward to the arrival of their second set of twins

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A young mountain biker gets a chopper ride off the side of a mountain when he breaks his leg, and a cardiac patient takes a terrifying turn

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: Intensive care paramedics prepare for the worst after a farm accident, and a child suffers a potentially life-threatening allergic reaction

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers go back to school as they transform students common rooms - and Michelle Ogundehin ups the stakes by telling them that the weakest two will be eliminated this week. Arriving at Gordano School in Bristol, the contestants work in pairs to update the four tired areas - one for each house in the school - as well as adjoining teachers offices. Alan Carr follows their progress, while guest judge Sophie Robinson offers her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Alan takes charge designing the first bedroom, but doubt soon sets in as Amanda and Scott struggle to get on board with his artistic vision. To nail his rustic chic look, Alan visits interior designer Marie at her 300-year-old palazzo and ropes in Amanda to help source vintage gems at Palermos famous flea market. Later, Amanda surprises Alan with a birthday boat trip along Sicilys stunning Zingaro coast

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A Lamborghini supercar crashes and bursts into flames leaving two passengers with serious injuries. Also, a patient requiring urgent care leaves the team with an outsized problem

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A car being pursued by police crashes and HART are called to treat a passenger trapped in her seat with serious injuries. Meanwhile, floodwaters swamp a Yorkshire town.

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A horse rider is hit by a car on a country road, leaving both her and her horse with serious injuries. Plus, the centre of Leeds is locked down after a suspicious package is found

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Its a race against time to dig out a man buried under three tonnes of soil, and the team are called to rescue the victims of a major crash involving a taxi

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A high-speed crash leaves a woman seriously injured and trapped in her crumpled car. Also, a man falls 20 feet through the roof of a Victorian factory

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Yorkshires HART paramedics race to help a man who has been stabbed in the back with a screwdriver, and theres a fire in a hotel resulting in a desperate search for those inside

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A man is left with a metal spike impaled in his face after a traumatic incident on a construction site, sparking a huge rescue operation. Medics help a man who was hit by a car

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: A newborn baby has breathing problems, paramedics treat an elderly lady whos fallen and hit her head, and crewmates investigate the worrying symptoms of a potential stroke victim

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics help a patient who fears hes having his third heart attack, and an elderly woman who had a fall at home and may have been lying on the floor all night

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics need to get a sick baby to hospital. They also treat a man who suffers from epilepsy and an elderly lady who needs to take her medication

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Nigel has keyhole surgery to repair his hernia - but things go wrong when hes back on the ward. Carol has a pin removed from her ankle, which was previously fractured

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Sleeps Over
programme.desc: Stacey meets single mum-of-eight Marie Buchan, a lightning rod in the fierce debate over the UK benefits system who has openly shared her state-funded lifestyle

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A mayday call from a yacht triggers a search and rescue operation involving multiple agencies including the Air Force and the Auckland Rescue Helicopter team

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A huge team of volunteers from across the South Island gathers on the West Coast to search for a Swedish national who went hunting in the Karangarua Valley area but never returned

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers hit the high street in Salisbury, where they work in pairs to give three retail businesses - a bridal shop, a homeware shop and a lingerie shop - a new lease of life. The designs range from the theatrical, with bold colours and wallpapers, and a cool, contemporary theme, to a safe, colourless look that plays into the hands of an owner who was worried about change. Alan Carr follows their progress, while retail expert Mary Portas joins Michelle Ogundehin to offer her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr transform the courtyard into a Mediterranean oasis. To brush up on their botany, the pair visit the magnificent gardens of one of Sicilys biggest wine producers, where they help out with the grape harvest. Keen to create an authentic Sicilian design, Alan explores Sciaccas famous ceramic scene and gets arty painting Moor Heads. He also enlists the help of two baroque-style painters to bring a touch of the islands rich history with a surprise courtyard centrepiece. Amanda repairs the old courtyard walls, which turns out to be a far bigger job than anticipated

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo starts his latest tour as Hampton Court Palace, where he is treated to a private tour of the Great Vine - the worlds longest grapevine - before moving on to stately Claremont House, where tragic circumstances led directly to the birth of the Victorian era. He then moves up the line to Wimbledon and the site of a historic duelling event before ending his journey in Teddington, where he hears the story of a reformer whose work revolutionised the care for those with living disabilities

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the final leg in Egham, Surrey, where a historic steam fair offers the original white-knuckle ride. Across town lies the Royal Holloway College, now part of the University of London, where the ex-politician discovers the institutions philanthropic roots. Moving into Berkshire, Portillo drops in at a factory manufacturing a famous sleep-inducing beverage with historic roots. Michaels journey ends at Henley-on-Thames in Oxfordshire, where he learns that rowing in an eight is a challenging business

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo takes a trip in a Second World War Spitfire above Biggin Hill aerodrome, and takes the train to East Grinstead on the trail of Winnie the Pooh. He also visits Plaw Hatch Farm, 200 acres of community-owned farmland that operates biodynamically according to principles first laid out in the 1920s

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Hassocks and makes his way to the beautiful Sussex village of Ditchling, where a Roman Catholic community of artists once made their home. Next, he visits the seaside town of Bexhill-on-Sea, before the Kent and East Sussex heritage railway conveys Michael from Bodiam Castle through the scenic Rother Valley to Tenterden, and finally arrives in the village of Benenden

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Oklahoma, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz uncover a baseball signed by one of the greatest players of all time

programme.title: Allo Allo!
programme.desc: The end of the war sees Rene, Edith and the rest of the gang welcoming in the Allied troops, and they soon find that the invasion party includes a couple of old friends

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor Meldrew finds himself forced into early retirement, but is determined not to end up on the scrapheap, pouring scorn on the modern world and driving everybody crazy in the process. Richard Wilson stars in the first-ever episode as misery guts Meldrew, with Annette Crosbie as his long-suffering wife. From 1990

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Margaret tries to take Victors mind off his depressing situation by encouraging him to attend a fitness class and read a book on how to cope with old age. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: The Quiller Memorandum
programme.desc: Two British spies based in 1960s Berlin are murdered, seemingly by a mysterious neo-Nazi organisation. The secret service drafts in an American agent to investigate the killings and uncover the identity of the leader of the extremist group. Thriller, starring George Segal, Alec Guinness, Max von Sydow and George Sanders, with a script by Harold Pinter

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows his 1930s Bradshaws guide to the unspoilt East Sussex port of Rye, where he learns about the loss of a generation of lifeboatmen in 1928. On the beaches at Rye, Michael explores one of 28,000 pillboxes constructed around the British coastline during the Second World War, before boarding the Romney, Hythe and Dymchurch railway to Dungeness

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the worlds most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the oceans edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs

programme.title: Wilderness with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon voyages across the Coral Triangle, a huge wilderness of tropical seas and jungle clad islands in the south-western Pacific, surrounded by the Philippines, Malaysia and Indonesia. It is one of the most beautiful and biodiverse corners of the words oceans and is crucial to the health of the wider marine environment, having been described as the Amazon of the seas

programme.title: Simply Raymond Blanc

The last meeting between the teams came in the 2019/20 EFL Cup, when Southampton recorded a comfortable 4-0 win at Fratton Park. However, a closer fought encounter is anticipated this time around now the sides are in the same division for the first time since the 2011/12 season. With commentary by Sam Matterface and Iain Dowie, analysis from Matt Taylor and Francis Benali, and reports by Aaron Paul

A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Perez tries to get the measure of Lloyd and, fearing they could ruin the life of an innocent man, asks for more time. programme.title: Shetland

A young womans body is discovered and the resorts owner, Jim Viner, fears the victim is his sister Deena when he returns from a weekend away with his daughter Clare. With Jims suspicions confirmed, a police report then reveals Clares boyfriend Ryan and his friends had been partying near the scene hours before the blaze started, but where are they now, and where is Deenas best friend Sally? As operations to enforce the law on the Branch Davidians began with the US Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms (ATF) and continued with the FBI, the siege ended with the deaths of men, women and children as a deadly fire raged at the groups compound. This episode features personal testimonies and reveals the profound influence that Waco still has today.

programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the grand final of the celebrity cooking contest - and the pressure is on as the three remaining stars battle it out in their toughest challenge yet. They take on their mentors signature dishes and the two who make it through to the final round will have to deliver a three-course meal in an epic head-to-head battle in a bid to lift the Golden Frying Pan

programme.title: Heathrow: Britains Busiest Airport
programme.desc: An inbound passenger has an entourage of armed police officers waiting for him, while a propeller plane arrives from the Isle of Man. Demi plunges into his favourite role of passenger saviour when 12 young divers are struggling to make their championship flight. Narrated by Julie Walters

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Johnny Vegas, Linda Robson and Ann Widdecombe to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.sub-title: The Chase: Im a Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as 2018 Im a Celebrity campmates Rita Simons, Malique Thompson-Dwyer, Fleur East and James McVey try to win as much money as they dare before teaming up in the final round against one of the shows five quiz experts. But which Chaser will they be facing tonight?

programme.title: You Bet!
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern returns with the game show, this time travelling around the UK to find ordinary people taking on extraordinary challenges for the chance to win £5,000. Placing their bets are a revolving celebrity panel, which this edition features Alesha Dixon, Josie Gibson, and Josh Widdicombe

programme.title: News at 5.30
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the Virgin Media News team

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Joel Kingston is a coppers copper from a respected and notable police family, but when he is found dead, floating in a park lake, DCI Vera Stanhope investigates both sides of the thin blue line in order to find his killer. A complex family dynamic, tensions at work, and brushes with the underworld, paint a dark and complex picture. Joel was there to serve and protect but did his stubborn commitment to justice at any price lead to his death? Murder mystery, starring Brenda Blethyn and Kenny Doughty

programme.title: Ant and Decs Limitless Win
programme.desc: Steve is back to finish his game with son-in-law Jordan, hoping to win enough money to get him and step-daughter Megan out of the house and set them up with a home of their own. Husband-and-wife team Richard and Lorna then face the Limitless Ladder looking to win some major money - theyve been doing some proper homework, but can they translate it into hard cash?

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: Danny Dyer: How to Be a Man
programme.desc: Danny Dyer travels the country exploring the contentious subject of modern masculinity, questioning whether men have lost their sense of identity and what it means to be male in 21st-century Britain. Along the way, he tries to get to the bottom of toxic masculinity and find out why so many young men are struggling with their mental health and relationships with women. Danny sets out to find out whether theres a rise in toxic masculinity in society and, if there is, why? He meets up with his brother Tony, before tackling controversial influencer Ed Matthews, meeting teenage boys at a London school, and speaking with Mansfield MP Ben Bradley, whos a champion of mens issues. He also meets male victims of domestic abuse, and in Brighton, he chats to members of the Brighton Gay Mens Chorus about overcoming prejudice

programme.title: Ridley
programme.desc: When a body is discovered at an illegal rave, Ridley and the investigative team are thrust into a high-profile case as victim Oliver Grant emerges as the heir apparent to his familys property empire and poised to become its next CEO. As they inch closer to uncovering the truth behind Olivers murder, the juxtaposition of the corporate world, the underground rave scene and Ridleys personal struggles weaves a gripping tale of mysterious intrigue

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick goes undercover to track down an escaped prisoner, Greengrass discovers a couple of naturists, and Auntie Eileen has a decision to make when she meets a face from her past. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry, Bill Maynard and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A white Christmas plunges Aidensfield into chaos, with Nick stranded in Jos cottage by heavy snow and Ventress caught in an awkward situation while wearing full Santa Claus gear. The police station is also invaded by Greengrasss geese - and a plane carrying a fugitive criminal and his pregnant wife crashes on the moors, leading to a desperate manhunt. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry, Juliette Gruber, William Simons and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick and Jo buy an engagement ring, but receive a hostile response to their news from her mother. Greengrass angers Blaketon by standing bail for a burglar. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry, Juliette Gruber and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective discovers his favourite 1970s band are on the verge of a comeback - along with their singer Esme Ford, who has made a shocking reappearance from beyond the grave, having faked her own death 35 years earlier. But when an orphan is found dead on the other side of town, a forensic link leads Lewis and Hathaway to suspect the aged rockers are somehow involved. Joanna Lumley, David Hayman, Simon Callow and Helen Baxendale guest star alongside Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian follows the work of Battersea Dogs and Cats Home in London, meeting staff involved in treating, training and rehoming animals. This time, Paul meets a 10-month-old puppy who has been brought into Battersea twice for being too boisterous, before helping to soothe a pointer cross who has had a hard life

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aaron once more tries to make his escape from John, whose defiance is unbreakable. Victoria is alarmed to finally hear first-hand from Paddy about his fears for Johns welfare

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Robert is left reeling, Charity is concerned when Jacob surprises Sarah and her with an early ultrasound, and Chas vows to make Robert pay

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Kammy questions whatis going on with Vinny, who eventually breaks down in tears, while Robert fears for Aarons life as he waits to be interviewed at the police station

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Kammy questions whatis going on with Vinny, who eventually breaks down in tears, while Robert fears for Aarons life as he waits to be interviewed at the police station

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Gabby is fed up that neither Bernice or Kim are coming to her wedding, Cain upsets Victoria, while Kammy has a plan

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: Crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Familys Zoe Wanamaker) and four known killers are among those who meet Poirot at a bridge evening arranged by wealthy adventurer Shaitana, who sits out the first game - only to be found later stabbed through the heart. As nobody has left or entered the victims apartment during the night, the guests combine their skills to discover which of the party is responsible. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Lesley Manville and Alex Jennings

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef rediscovers some wasabi plants in his kitchen garden, and decides to find out more, including how to grow them at the UKs only wasabi farm. Back on home turf, Marcus checks on his ducks and gathers up a glut of lavender to take to local gelato-maker, Grant

programme.title: Paul OGrady for the Love of Dogs: What Happened Next
programme.desc: The comedian catches up with some of the most memorable dogs he has met from the eight years he has spent at Battersea Dogs and Cats Home. In the third episode of the series, Paul has a heart-warming reunion with Whisper, the most anxious dog he met during his time at Battersea, and finds out how a puppy born with a missing paw is enjoying its new life. Plus, Paul catches up with Cookie, the Staffie who now works as a prison sniffer dog, and Max, an obese dog who needed a diet as well as a new home

programme.title: Nathan Carter Live in Sligo
programme.desc: An electrifying stage performance, showcasing Carters dynamic live show and incredible band, boasting high-energy music and captivating performances

programme.title: MandS: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: Irish model and media personality Vogue Williams joins the judging panel as the amateur designers face the challenges that come along with making childrens wear. AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host as the contestants designs are put forward to both the judging panel and the general public

programme.title: After the Flood
programme.desc: When PC Jo Marshall finds a man dead in a lift in an underground car park after a flood, police assume he became trapped in the rising water. However, Jo becomes obsessed with finding out the truth and the investigation changes her life for ever. Mystery thriller, starring Sophie Rundle

programme.title: Rig 45
programme.desc: With another murder happening on board the ship, the people left realize that the killer is one of those who managed to escape from the rig

programme.title: Thief of Time
programme.desc: After a second burial site is looted, tribal detectives Leaphorn and Chee hunt for missing artifacts and an anthropologist suspected of stealing them. Mystery thriller, starring Gary Farmer, Adam Beach and Ernest Tsosie III

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Family members are found slain at their breakfast table, and Dr Lucien Blake knows something about the scene doesnt seem right, but cant put his finger on it. Meanwhile, Jeans wayward son returns unexpectedly and causes quite a stir in the household

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A special constable mysteriously disappears after a row with pig farmer Betty Sutch. His uniform is discovered in the pig sty and macabre rumours begin to circulate the village that implicate his wife. Meanwhile, Greengrass benefits from a cleaner house when he puts up an old friend. Nick Berry and Bill Maynard star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An Aidensfield housewife is found dead and suspicion falls on her schoolboy son, who promptly makes matters worse for himself by disappearing. Jo moves in to Maggies house. Nick Berry stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass embarks on his most bizarre exploit yet - robbing a grave in Aidensfield churchyard to retrieve a stuffed sheep that has mistakenly been buried instead of its former owner. It sounds like something out of a macabre black comedy, but as usual theres a method in his madness - and a quick profit uppermost in his mind. Nick Berry and Bill Maynard star

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The body of Dr Stephen Black is found on an Oxford tour bus, and the detectives are led to sprawling Crevecoeur Hall, where Hathaway spent much of his childhood. As he investigates, he is drawn to Scarlett Mortmaigne, the glamorous daughter of the estates owner, but when another corpse is discovered, Hathaways refusal to believe the family is involved threatens to test his relationship with Lewis to breaking point. Guest starring Nathaniel Parker (The Inspector Lynley Mysteries), Juliet Aubrey (Primeval) and Stella Gonet (Holby City), with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Betsys birthday is one to remember and Carl has a job for Brody and Dylan. David worries when he finds a pregnancy test in the bin and Sarah suggests it could be Lilys

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Betsys birthday is one to remember and Carl has a job for Brody and Dylan. David worries when he finds a pregnancy test in the bin and Sarah suggests it could be Lilys

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Lisa reels in shock and the walls close in on Carl and Dylan as George reveals he saw who was driving the car. The owner of the pregnancy test comes forward

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Lisa reels in shock and the walls close in on Carl and Dylan as George reveals he saw who was driving the car. The owner of the pregnancy test comes forward

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie travels to Staffordshire to meet an entrepreneur whose hoard of ceramics and glass is taking over her home. Plus, a man from Shropshire, who owns an extensive collection of army tanks, is challenged to transform his mechanical mess into money at auction

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: Richard Abernethie is found dead shortly after disinheriting his sole heir and specifying that his legacy is to be divided equally among the remaining family members. Poirot is called in by his solicitor friend Gilbert Entwhistle, to ascertain whether the late Mr Abernethie met with foul play - and also finds time to investigate the murder of a beneficiary under the new terms of the will. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Robert Bathurst, Anna Calder-Marshall and Geraldine James

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef ventures out to Romney Marsh to meet shepherd Chris to learn what gives salt-marsh lamb its flavour, and visits a nearby school that has set up its own farm

programme.title: Save Money: My Beautiful Green Home
programme.desc: Ranvir Singh follows three families as they transform their traditional properties into eco-friendly homes, with advice from property expert Kunle Barker. in the first edition, Ranvir and Kunle travel to Manchester to meet Sian and Glenn Absalom, who want to redo their kitchen on a shoestring budget

programme.title: How to Lose Weight Well
programme.sub-title: From the Sirtfood to the Yoga Diet
programme.desc: Doctors Helen Lawal and Javid Abdelmoneim help people try out the most popular diets on the market, with participants being put on a variety of regimens. Sisters Lesley and Debra from Essex road-test diets followed by celebrities Adele and Rebel Wilson, while friends Temi and Bose try out intermittent fasting, and drinking pals Maurice and Mick want to lose weight before attempting a Three Peaks walk in their native Yorkshire

programme.title: Hairy Bikers: Route 66
programme.desc: Dave and Si cross the state of Arizona in search of the Wild West and make a small detour from Route 66, starting in Monument Valley, to learn more about this striking place. Theyre invited by a local Navajo police officer to eat with his family at a traditional Navajo barbecue, where a sheep is butchered, grilled and eaten alongside some traditional fry bread. Still riding in the Navajo Nation, the bikers stop at Tsaile College to learn more about rodeo and cook a lamb stew with corn dumplings in homage of the Navajo people they met

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates the documentary series revealing the incredible ways in which all life is impacted throughout the four seasons

programme.title: The Widower
programme.desc: Factual drama based on the crimes of convicted murderer Malcolm Webster, co-written by Bafta winner Jeff Pope (Philomena). When mild-mannered nurse Malcolm (Reece Shearsmith) is confronted by his new wife over his wild spending, he starts to drug her to keep her quiet. However, a medical check-up then threatens to expose him, so he decides to silence his spouse once and for all. Three years on, he has a new bride - and history appears to be repeating itself. With Sheridan Smith and Kate Fleetwood

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: The comedy returns to follow another year in the life of the widow, her family and friends. It is Cathys 60th birthday and the family are going to lunch. Starring Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: Cathy and Michael have plans to clear the front room on Easter Sunday, but Jason and Kelly have other ideas. Subtle family comedy, starring Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Hansons presence in Cornwall raises suspicion and as Demelza wrestles with how best to equip the community to look after itself, Morwenna lends herself to the cause and finds new hope. Geoffrey Charles and Cecilys relationship continues to blossom, but Georges sanity continues to deteriorate and Cary struggles under mounting responsibilities. The Enyses look to challenge the countys high society by hosting a ball to introduce the Despards, before disaster strikes and Ross and Ned must spring into action together

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: A Ballarat College schoolboy-rower wins a race on Lake Wendouree - only to drown after being ceremonially tossed in the lake. His mother asks Doctor Blake to find the truth behind her sons death, but Blake discovers that the truth is a murkier affair than expected, and that the boy was not the small-town sporting hero everyone - including his mother - thought he was

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Ian Wright in which contestants answer questions to try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. The money up for grabs continues to climb but so does the pressure as one final ball needs to be played - the Moneyball - that could see a player leaving with their hard-earned prize or going home with nothing

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Wild Britain
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on animals that inhabit some of Britains 6,000 islands, including a rare sheep that can survive on seaweed and red deer stags in the Hebrides. Some lose their lives in the bid to win females, but their death is a bonanza for scavengers - from hooded crows and buzzards to the majestic golden eagle

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Comedian Vic Reeves and his wife Nancy Sorrell put on a dinner party as they play host to four strangers, who have to try and work out their identities by solving cryptic clues. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Magazine Show
programme.desc: All the latest from the world of the UEFA Champions League, featuring highlights and interviews

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: In preparation for its launch of a new fleet of intercity express trains, Great Western Railway and Network Rail work hard to upgrade the track and the stations serve them. To mark the 175th anniversary of Queen Victoria becoming the first monarch to travel by train, the Queen will make the same journey from Slough to Paddington on one of the new trains. Further along the line at Reading, revenue protection inspector Lyn has been alerted to a man travelling without a ticket

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: The Mike Tomlin Show
programme.desc: A catch-up with all the gameweek happenings right from the horses mouth, as Pittsburgh Steelers coach Mike Tomlin revisits recent action

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single unbeatable answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three more contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of the regular cast of contributors known as the Think Tank

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie meets Mark whose clutter takes him back to his childhood, but after spending £17,000 storing it, his wife Susan believes its time to grow up and clear out. She also helps Tricia find gold among her hoard, and sees some precious memories relived

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Soprano Lesley Garrett puts on a dinner party for four strangers, who have to work out the identity of their mystery celebrity host with the help of a few cryptic clues - otherwise they will be doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Single shoppers Natalie, Molly and Dumebi are hoping to win the heart of fitness coach Deji, and they will be picking outfits for him based on his instructions

programme.title: John and Lisas Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner demonstrate four meals that can all be made in around 30 minutes, beginning with fish finger katsu tacos with pickles, and pan-fried herb gnocchi with tomatoes, olives and rocket. John also prepares beef chow mein served with prawn crackers, while Lisa makes easy peaches and clotted cream scones with a compote on the side

programme.title: Hells Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs feel the heat during a pasta challenge, and one team dishes out a stellar dinner service while the other faces Gordons wrath.

programme.title: Tell Me Everything
programme.desc: Mei wants to move back to Canada after the attack from Brett, and when Jonny makes a shock discovery, he decides that hes going to head across the Atlantic too

programme.title: Gogglebox Ireland
programme.desc: A star-studded line-up including Rosie ODonnell, Emma Doran, Deirdre OKane, Pat Shortt and Garron Noone, and stars of The Chase Shaun Wallace, Darragh Ennis and Jenny Ryan offer their opinions on the best small-screen moments from the past week. Others popping up with their thoughts are Louis Walsh, Dave Fanning, Ray DArcy, Dustin the Turkey, Lucy Kennedy and podcast stars the Young Hot Guys

programme.desc: A look at events leading to the death of comedy actor Desi Arnaz

programme.title: Wild Britain
programme.desc: Cameras follow some of the animals that thrive in inner-city environments across the country. Urban foxes did not exist in Britain until the 1930s, but now these animals inhabit 90% of towns and cities and take residence in built-up living quarters. Meanwhile, cameras observe families of hedgehogs thriving in unkempt gardens, and peregrine falcons nesting in some on Londons tallest buildings

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: DJ Mike Read puts on a dinner party at his Oxfordshire home for four dinner guests as he plays mystery celebrity host. Will they need to take host Brian McFaddens Poptastic bonus to guess Reads identity?

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: A driver raises the alarm when he suspects that his train has hit something - or someone - on the line, while heavy rain brings down a tree which closes the tracks between Banbury and Oxford. Plus, engineers begin the process of dismantling a Victorian viaduct

Plus, she travels to Birmingham to meet David, who is struggling to tackle the seven-year problem of sorting out his parents cluttered house - and matters come to a head with an unexpected proposition

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Brian McFadden invites Team Fitness to guess the identity of another celebrity host, this time in the form of Steps star Ian H Watkins

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Michelin-starred chef Matt Gillan puts four home cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make mushrooms on toast. Hosted by Sheree Murphy

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a pug-terrier cross who has been badly injured in an accident involving a car, and a 10-month-old bulldog recovering from airway surgery. Elsewhere, Paul bumps into Jennifer Saunders, one of Batterseas famous volunteers, who like Paul, struggles to fight the urge to adopt all the dogs at the shelter

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul dons protective clothing to help with treatments on 11-week-old Humphrey, a Bedlington Terrier suffering from ringworm, which include medicated baths. As he helps with his treatments, his head is turned by the small pup, who is struggling to stop scratching himself. Elsewhere, he also joins head vet Shaun on the streets as he does his rounds treating dogs belonging to Londons homeless people, and meets a six-month-old golden retriever that was found tied to a railing and is in need of some serious training

programme.title: Tour de Fred: Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The final stage of Fred Sirieixs gastronomic tour takes him to Derry during the Halloween festival where he dances his way through the parade and explores the arboretum and BBQ school at Brook Hall. He also tackles a cycling challenge to the village of Muff in nearby County Donegal and meets Mickey Bradley from the Undertones

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Emmy, Grammy, Oscar and Tony-winning actor Viola Davis, star of Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 Will Poulter and renowned comedian Jack Dee. Plus, a performance from Simple Minds of their iconic hit Dont You (Forget About Me) ahead of the songs 40th anniversary

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by Irish actor and singer Jessie Buckley, starring in Charlie Kaufmans Netflix drama Im Thinking of Ending Things. Also appearing are comedian Bill Bailey - one of this years Strictly contestants - plus fellow comic and childrens author David Walliams. Singer Dermot Kennedy performs his single Giants, and the host offers a wry look at some trending news stories

programme.title: Harry and Meghan: Is America Turning Against Them?
programme.desc: A look at whether the Duke and Duchess of Sussexs popularity in the United States is on the wane amid heavy criticism and parody that has been levelled at them. At one point they were the darlings of LA and indeed America, with mega money deals, podcasts and exclusive TV appearances galore, but the tide appears to have turned, and the once enthralled American publics interest is waning
